description: Apparently a plural form of taw, though attested earlier.

entries.meaning: (chiefly Scotland) A leather strap or thong which is split into (typically three) tails, used for corporal punishment in schools, applied to the palm of the hands or buttocks.

verbs.description: tawse (third-person singular simple present tawses, present participle tawsing, simple past and past participle tawsed)

entries.meaning: (transitive, chiefly Scotland) To beat with a tawse.
